item.title: Covid-19 and technocratic societies
item.description: The year was 1909. Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi was on board the SS Kildonan Castle when he had started working on what was later considered his seminal work, a book named “Hind Swaraj” (published as “Indian Home Rule” in English). Making his arguments against modernity and - what he considers - the “westernization” of India, he wrote: “Good travels at a snail’s pace â€” it can, therefore, have little to do with the railways.
